intro: Camptosorus rhizophyllus f. auriculatus, commonly known as the golden ear fern, is a rare and unique fern species characterized by its distinctive golden-colored fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant features a creeping rhizome with clustered, leathery, and often auriculate (ear-shaped) fronds that are typically bright green with a metallic sheen. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is highly sought after by botanists and plant enthusiasts.
